summary: This is an email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and others, likely FBI agents, regarding the exchange and review of FBI 302 interview reports and handwritten notes in the Epstein case. The email discusses tracking over 120 interviews, identifying missing reports, and requesting specific notes.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, coordinating the review of FBI 302s and interview notes, mentions there have been more than 120 interviews in the case.

events.title: Email review of interview materials
events.description: An email notes the completion of a full review and cross-reference of all materials in the case, indicating over 120 interviews have been conducted.

events.title: Exchange of 302s and notes
events.description: Email correspondence includes attachments of FBI 302s and interview notes, with a request for notes from two specific phone interviews.

keyFacts: The document reveals the investigation involved more than 120 interviews.
Prosecutors were conducting a detailed audit of FBI 302 reports and corresponding handwritten interview notes to identify missing materials.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and investigative agents to ensure all interview records were accounted for.
Specific interviews are referenced by file numbers (e.g., EFTA00086959, EFTA00086960), indicating a structured record-keeping system.
